page.title: 05LOCAL HISTORY-AVERHAM
page.content: An interesting aspect of local history is The Robin Hood Theatre.It was founded by the Reverand Walker.It forms a part of the cultural develop- ment of the village and has a mixture of amateur and professional produc- tions.Sir D.Wolfitt began his acting career at this theatre.Many famous people have entertained here.An Amat- eur Company produces regular plays. Professional companies of actors,pupp- eteers and mime artists make regular appearances.The theatre is fairly well patronised and has suffered from the economic cutbacks of the eighties. Another building of local,historical interest is St.Michaels and All Angles Church.It is the religious centre for the community.The herringbone brickwork is very old.Ex-ray photography recently recorded hidden wall paintings.
